head.title: FRANKLIN IS IN $825 MILLION DEAL FOR MONEY MANAGER

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: FRANKLIN IS IN $825 MILLION DEAL FOR MONEY MANAGER

abstract.p: Franklin Resources, operator of Franklin, Templeton and Mutual Series mutual fund groups, announces deal to acquire Fiduciary Trust for $825 million in all-stock transaction; new company will manage assets of $280 billion; Franklin chairman-chief executive Charles B Johnson comments (S)

block.p: Franklin Resources, the operator of the Franklin, Templeton and Mutual Series mutual fund groups, announced a deal yesterday to acquire Fiduciary Trust for $825 million in an all-stock transaction. The new company will manage assets of more than $280 billion. Charles B. Johnson, chairman and chief executive of Franklin, said the deal would combine ''complementary'' businesses. ''Franklin has been primarily a retail operation and Fiduciary has been primarily an institutional operation,'' he said. Franklin, based in San Mateo, Calif., is the No. 8 manager of mutual funds. Fiduciary Trust of New York manages about $50 billion for wealthy and institutional clients.

Franklin Resources, the operator of the Franklin, Templeton and Mutual Series mutual fund groups, announced a deal yesterday to acquire Fiduciary Trust for $825 million in an all-stock transaction. The new company will manage assets of more than $280 billion. Charles B. Johnson, chairman and chief executive of Franklin, said the deal would combine ''complementary'' businesses. ''Franklin has been primarily a retail operation and Fiduciary has been primarily an institutional operation,'' he said. Franklin, based in San Mateo, Calif., is the No. 8 manager of mutual funds. Fiduciary Trust of New York manages about $50 billion for wealthy and institutional clients.
